page.title: 13 'Adopt A Calf' Scheme
page.content: {Gold Top Dairy Products}are produced by{Jersey and Guernsey}cows.The scheme fosters an interest in dairy products and involves children in working with cattle.{Class 1 at St.Giles School participated in the 1985 scheme with other Essex schools.The class visited the Jersey cattle at Brickwall Farm, Sible Hedingham and chose a calf called{Jasmine}to care for.Mrs.Fuller, the county organiser encouraged all the children to visit the farm several times to learn about the cattle and the work in the dairy.The children found information about Jerseys,made a book,drew graphs,set up a model and sewed a collage.This display was on public view at{Essex Show}in June. Three pupils learned to groom,lead and handle Jasmine so she could be 'shown' in the judging ring.
